application_instruction: Note: A writing sample will be required as part of the interview process.
description:
Whether you're on a consumer product (like Gmail, Search, Maps, Chrome, Android) or a business product (Google Ads, AdSense, Google Marketing Platform, Analytics), you take part in a complete marketing experience as you lead every facet of the product's journey. From determining positioning, naming, competitive analysis, feature prioritization and external communications, you help shape the voice of the product and help it grow a loyal consumer base. This means you work with a cross-functional team across sales, corporate communications, legal, webmasters, product development, engineering and more. In this role, you'll be involved with product marketing strategy from beginning to end.

As a Brand Marketing Manager you will have the exciting opportunity to work on a visible part of Google's brand that aims to surprise, delight, and inspire curiosity as well as relay our brand values to billions of people around the world. You'll also have the unique opportunity to work on both brand and product marketing every day.

You'll play a vital role in taking Doodles marketing to the next level by helping build marketing amplifications around important global Doodle launches (e.g., partnerships with both internal product/content teams or external influencers and organizations) as well as helping build a more robust Doodles social and communications strategy. You will also be responsible for managing various marketing and communications aspects of the day-to-day Doodle process, which includes extensive work with marketers and cross-functional teams around the world. You're self-motivated, strategic and creative with proven execution and writing skills. You also have an unwavering passion for celebrating diverse cultures and building an emotional connection with users everywhere.

Know the user. Know the magic. Connect the two. At its core, marketing at Google starts with technology and ends with the user, bringing both together in unconventional ways. Our job is to demonstrate how Google's products solve the world's problems--from the everyday to the epic, from the mundane to the monumental. And we approach marketing in a way that only Google can--changing the game, redefining the medium, making the user the priority, and ultimately, letting the technology speak for itself.
eeo: At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 3 years of relevant work experience.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Demonstrated understanding of the user and interest to build meaningful, emotional connections with them. Deep understanding of Google's brand values and challenges and of the Google voice.
  • Big picture thinker, with the ability to scope appropriately then execute effectively. Excellent writing and editorial skills. Ability to write for anything (e.g., social copy, blog posts, etc.).
  • Familiarity with running paid social activities across a variety of channels, such as paid campaigns and influencer campaigns.
  • Comfortable interacting with a wide range of audiences from peers to senior leadership. Ability to use a global mindset and think across cultures, audiences, and scenarios.
  • Motivated, strategic, hard-working leader, with the ability to balance multiple work streams in a fast-paced environment with great attention to detail.
  • Quick learner, excellent problem-solver and ability to think about the situation at hand and escalate when necessary, bringing proposals for how to solve the problem to the table.
responsibilities:
• Lead end-to-end marketing amplifications on select Doodle launches, including internal and/or external partnerships.
  • Lead Doodle blog editorial process to amplify the narratives and behind-the-scenes content of Doodles globally.
  • Lead Doodles social strategy and execution, both day-to-day and for Doodle amplification campaigns.
  • Lead all aspects of Local Doodle Manager training/onboarding and management.
  • Lead monthly communications and Doodle impact newsletters.
title: Brand Marketing Manager, Doodles
